Orphapacket.Label: Hypertension due to gain-of-function mutations in the mineralocorticoid receptor

Synonyms.Synonym: Early-onset hypertension with exacerbation in pregnancy

TextSection.Contents: A rare genetic cause of hypertension characterized by severe early-onset therapy-resistant hypertension due to a gain-of-function mutation in the mineralocorticoid receptor. The condition is associated with suppressed plasma renin activity and low serum aldosterone levels and is markedly exacerbated during pregnancy.

Parent.Label: Rare disorder potentially indicated for kidney transplant
Rare disorder related with pregnancy, childbirth and puerperium
